definitions.definition: lengths of pipe, or a network of pipes, made of metal, plastic, or other materials.
ornamentation on food consisting of lines of icing, whipped cream, etc.
thin cord covered in fabric, used to decorate clothing or soft furnishings and reinforce seams.
the action or art of playing a pipe or pipes.
convey (water, gas, oil, or other fluid substances) through a pipe or pipes.
examples: water from the lakes is piped to several towns
synonyms: convey "the beer is piped into barrels"

definitions.definition: transmit (music, a radio or television program, signals, etc.) by wire or cable.
examples: transmit, feed, patch television shows piped in from New York

definitions.definition: play (a tune) on a pipe or pipes.
examples: play on a pipe, tootle, whistle; flute he heard a tune being piped

definitions.definition: (of a bird) sing in a high or shrill voice.
examples: chirp, cheep, chirrup, twitter, warble, trill, peep, sing, shrill a curlew piped

definitions.definition: say something in a high, shrill voice.
use a boatswain's whistle to summon (the crew) to work or a meal.
examples: the hands were piped to breakfast

definitions.definition: decorate (clothing or soft furnishings) with a thin cord covered in fabric.
put (a decorative line or pattern) on a cake or similar dish using icing, whipped cream, etc.
